text:
When using v3 to create new contact endpoint, if there is already a record w/ that email if should return:
`Contact already exists. Existing ID: <CRMID>`
Recently, it started returning just “`Contact already exists`” in some cases.

Anyone experienced that? This really breaks our flow as we cannot match the current contact id back to our db.
I also don’t understand why the existing id  was not moved into a separate field already - there has been a request from 3 (!) years ago and leaving it as a string to parse is bad design .
Hi! Same thought here, parsing from string is a bad design. But it’s the only way I’ve seen until today.
